H0.text: The swim bladder enables fish to remain at a certain depth without expending energy through swimming.

H1.text: The lateral line is the structure that enables fish to remain at a certain depth without expending energy through swimming.

H2.text: The dorsal fin enables fish to remain at a certain depth without expending energy through swimming.

H3.text: Gill slits enable fish to remain at a certain depth without expending energy through swimming.

A4.text: The swim bladder is an internal gas-filled organ in bony fish that functions to modulate buoyancy, and thus allowing the fish to stay at desired water depth without having to maintain lift via swimming, which expends more energy.

A5.text: By adjusting the gas pressurising organ using the gas gland or oval window, the fish can obtain neutral buoyancy and ascend and descend to a large range of depths.
